curated_text: Symbol: PFE. Year: 2022. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: BMS, the High Court’s, Trademark Office, the European Patent Office, the Patent Trial and Appeal Board, PFIZER INC., UNAUDITED, Sandoz, the U.S., District Court, FDA, EpiPen, Xeljanz, Aurobindo Pharma Limited, Aurobindo, Sinotherapeutics Inc., Sinotherapeutics, Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc., Teva, Glenmark Pharmaceuticals Ltd., Glenmark, Inlyta., Ibrance, Eucrisa, Alnylam Pharmaceuticals, Pfizer, Pharmacia & Upjohn Co., LLC, Comirnaty, BMS Paragraph-IV, the Orange Book for Eliquis, the U.S. District Court, the District Court’s, the U.S. Court of Appeals, the Federal Circuit, Warner-Lambert, American Optical Corporation, American Optical, the District Court, the Third Circuit, Ranbaxy Laboratories Ltd., Multi-District Litigation, the Court of Appeals, Pfizer and Ranbaxy, the State of West Virginia, King and Meridian, Mylan, Protonix and/or Nexium 24HR, Consumer Healthcare JV, GSK, Docetaxel • Personal Injury Actions, Docetaxel, the Mississippi Consumer Protection Act, Zantac, the Multi-District Litigation, the State of New Mexico, City Council of Baltimore, Judicial Council Coordinated Proceeding, the Superior Court of California, Champix, Monsanto Company, Monsanto, Solutia Inc., Pharmacia & Upjohn Company, Solutia, New Monsanto, the Wyeth Holdings Corporation, American Cyanamid Company, Bound Brook, Wyeth Holdings Corporation, Administrative Settlement Agreement, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, EPA, the Bound Brook, the Bound Brook facility’s, Wyeth Holdings LLC, the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Iraqi Ministry of Health In, the Iraqi Ministry of Health, Allergan Finance LLC, the Supreme Court, the State of New York, Viatris Securities Litigation, the Court of Common Pleas of, Mylan N.V., the Upjohn Business, Transactions. Context excerpt: competition and/or violations of antitrust laws. In addition to the challenges to the U.S. patents that are discussed below, patent rights to certain of our products or those of our collaboration/licensing partners are being challenged in various other jurisdictions. Some of our collaboration or licensing partners face challenges to the validity of their patent rights in non-U.S. jurisdictions. For example, in April 2022, the U.K. High Court issued a judgment finding invalid a BMS patent related to Eliquis due to expire in 2026. BMS will seek permission to appeal the High Court’s decision. Additional challenges remain pending in other jurisdictions. We are also party to patent damages suits in various jurisdictions pursuant to which generic drug manufacturers, payers, governments or other parties are seeking damages from us for allegedly causing delay of generic entry. We also are often involved in other proceedings, such as inter partes review, post-grant review, re-examination or opp
